case.name: Stoyef v Masu Financial Management Pty Ltd (No 2) [2008] FCA 1849 (5 December 2008)

citphrases.citphrase: class action against financial services licensee which advised applicant and group members to invest in promissory notes without giving them a product disclosure statement (pds) as (allegedly) required by s 1012a(1) of corporations act 2001 (cth)
whether applicant required to plead knowledge that scheme was required to be registered but was not registered and was therefore liable to be wound up so as to displace s 1013c(2) of the act
whether, on the other hand, respondent required to plead lack of such knowledge by way of defence
whether pleading of what pds would have stated amounted to a pleading of actual knowledge.

legistitles.title: FEDERAL COURT OF AUSTRALIA ACT 1976
FEDERAL COURT OF AUSTRALIA ACT 1976 - SECT 33L Situation where fewer than 7 group members
FEDERAL COURT OF AUSTRALIA ACT 1976 - SECT 33V Settlement and discontinuance--representative proceeding
